channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Uncleaned Road & rubisj, 21st August
item.description:
Was rubbish black bag & lots of rubbish on.the road. That bag was still two weeks. Reported already. Nothing happened yet. I don't think this road is clean this summer We are here nearly 30 years. It was a very clean road. Please sort out this issue. .

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Every. Damn. Day, 21st August

item.title: Kerb by tree outside of No. 31 Oval road, 21st August
item.description:
The kerb outside of no. 31 next trip the tree has settled in a way that pops car tyres, which has happened to me today. Due to the tree pushing the kerb outward to a point, the angle and cut of the kerb sits in a way that when attempting to park in the box, the tyre catches and pinches and pops the tyre. Literally today is the 3rd time this has happened to me personally at this specific location; I'm aware of it it and trying to park sensibly, yet my tyre is damaged - exclusively due to the way this kerb has set. I'd imagine simply rounding the edge out would help. Because the kerb directly around the tree is new, the edge is at quite a sharp angle. Either way the current layout is damaging my car.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29, Oval Road, Chalk Farm, London
Report on FixMyStreet
